body:
**How this date has been worked out**

The expiry date of your conviction is based on:

* what you told us about your conviction
* the current law on when convictions expire

This table shows you what you told us. If any of this information is wrong, the expiry date we've given you might also be wrong.

 | | |
|---|---|
| Criminal record type | **Conviction**|
| Type of conviction | **Community** |
| Name of conviction | **Curfew** |
| Age at time of caution | **Under 18** |
| Date of conviction | **17 September 2018**|
| Date conviction ended | **17 March 2019** |
___

components.html:
If you need to change any information, or if you have another caution or conviction youâ€™d like to check, [use the service again](/).

**[Print this page](/)**

heading: Your conviction will expire on 17 September 2019
lede: After this date you will not need to tell anyone about the conviction unless an [exception applies](https://www.gov.uk/exoffenders-and-employment?#when-employers-still-need-to-know-about-your-conviction).
